meta.title: Home - Tracy Unified School District - Best District in San Joaquin

meta.content: Home - Tracy Unified School District - Best District in San Joaquin

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

li.a: Access to Optional Educational Opportunities During School Closure
George & Evelyn Stein Continuation High School
George & Evelyn Stein Continuation High School
Access to Optional Educational Opportunities During School Closure

header.h2: Welcome to the Tracy Unified School District

div.p: Tracy Unified School District prepares our diverse student population to be college and career ready for the 21st Century by providing a quality-learning environment in safe, modern facilities equipped with the latest technological tools. Our world class, culturally proficient staff empowers students to reach their fullest potential and prepares students to solve real-world problems by utilizing best instructional practices and collaborating with the community, businesses and institutions of higher learning.
All students in Tracy Unified School District will become lifelong learners, responsible citizens, and leaders in the 21st Century.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_15 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.title: BOARD MEETING WITH VARIOUS COLORS AROUND IT

img.alt: BOARD MEETING WITH VARIOUS COLORS AROUND IT

div.p: Due to COVID-19, TUSD Board Meetings will be live-streamed to the public. Public comments can be submitted on board meeting day between the hours of 5:00 and 6:00 pm.
To view the current agenda, watch the board meeting or make a comment, please visit:
For the convenience of families with incoming students for the 2020/2021 school year, TUSD is encouraging parents to proceed with registration.
To register your student, please use our Aeries Online Enrollment Form found at https://sisweb.tusd.net/air/ or visit our website at: www.tracy.k12.ca.us and navigate to Aeries Online Enrollment.
Allow 20-30 minutes to complete the Aeries Online Enrollment process.
Please view REGISTRATION INFORMATION for a list of Required documents and emails.

div.title: The letter A with a plus sign in red

img.alt: The letter A with a plus sign in red

div.p: Tracy Unified School District recognizes that school closures due to COVID-19 are challenging times for our students and families. The California Department of Education requires districts to provide Distance Learning Education to our students during school closure to include assigned work. As stated by California Department of Education, for the duration of school closure due to COVID-19, “students shall be held harmless”. This means Distance Learning assignments during school closure may only be used to help a student’s grade.

The District is currently working on a Distance Learning Grading Plan for grades PreK-12 for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, with the end result that all teachers assign final grades for all students at the conclusion of the school year. More information will be provided by the District in the near future regarding the grading plan.
Distance Learning web pages are available on each school website. Look for the "Distance Learning" icon. We also have all school page links on the district COVID19/School Closure page.
Distance Learning work will be graded. Please review all information on your school's website.
Starting April 20th teachers will have office hours and emails to contact them. They are posted on each district learning page in the upper right hand corner.

div.title: Preschool news written on blackboard with flower

img.alt: Preschool news written on blackboard with flower

div.p: We would like to offer you the dates and times below to pick up an enrollment packet for the 2020-2021 school year. Please note that in order to register your child for preschool, your child’s birthdate must fall between December 3, 2015 to September 1, 2016.

p.b: Please join us at one of our packet drive-thru pick up dates below to get an application at:
Please join us at one of our packet drive-thru pick up dates below to get an application at:

Thursday, April 9th – 9:00-1:00 pm
Friday, April 24th – 1:00-5:00 pm
Friday, May 8th – 9:00-1:00 pm
Friday, May 15th – 1:00-5:00 pm

div.p: Tasha Mathews: tmathews@tusd.net
Marie Martinez: mmartinez@tusd.net

font.b: Available from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday

p.strong: Dial above number and select Option

main.p: The goal of our Tracy Unified School District community helpline is to connect our students, families and staff to a live operator between the hours of 9 am to 5 pm. Our live operators will serve as a resource for individuals who may be in need of a school counselor, a school nurse, or mental health, foster and/or homeless information and resources. Our school counselors, health service nurses, and prevention services support providers will operate the Tracy Unified School District helpline. As a caller, you can choose the department of your choice by following the prompts addressed in the pre-recorded message. As a reminder, if you are experiencing a life-threatening emergency please dial 911. For specific school or classroom related information, please contact your school site teacher and/or administrator by email. For all other questions, please contact the TUSD student services department at (209) 830-3280.

div.p: During school closure, we will have an FAQ posted to our webpage.
This will be updated frequently as we receive more information.
Thank you!

div.title: FREE MEALS FOR CHILDREN WITH FOOD

img.alt: FREE MEALS FOR CHILDREN WITH FOOD

div.p: TUSD is distributing free lunch and breakfast to all students between the ages of 2 and 18 years old, and to our students enrolled in the Young Adult Program.
Drive through locations are available 11:30am to 12:30pm weekdays and are listed here:
Tracy Unified is pleased to announce that we will begin using the Raptor Visitor Management System in all of our schools to strengthen our campus safety for students and faculty.
All visitors will be asked to present an ID such as a driver's license and it will be scanned into the Raptor system.
For more information, please read the letter below:
The purpose of our Census outreach is to educate, motivate, and activate students, parents, and families to engage in the 2020 Census.
For more information, please visit our student services page.
For information regarding COVID19 and our school closures, please Visit our "COVID19 - School Closure Information Page".
This page contains information on:

Parent letters
Preschool
Help Line
FAQs
SENIOR -FAQs
Kinder Registration
Special Education News
Distance Learning Links
